document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Hypatopa Walsingham, 1907 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) in China, with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Hypatopa Walsingham, 1907 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) in China, with descriptions of five new species

bibRefCitation.author: Kuznetzov, V. I.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kuznetzov, V. I. (1984) New species of the moths of the infraordo Papilionomorpha (Lepidoptera: Stathmopodidae, Blastobasi- dae, Aeolanthidae) from the Asiatic part of USSR. Trudy Zoologicheskogo Instituta, Leningrad, 122, 77 - 86.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hypatopa silvestrella
Kuznetzov, 1984 : 81
. Type locality: Russia ( Primorskiy Territory).

Diagnosis . Forewing length 7.5–10.0 mm ( Fig. 2 ).
Hypatopa silvestrella
is similar to
H. moriutiella
Sinev, 1986
in the male genitalia, but it can be separated by having a well sclerotized juxta, and dense dentitions on the phallus on the distal 1/7 laterally ( Fig. 10 ). In
H. moriutiella
the juxta is ill-defined, and the phallus lacks dentitions.
Hypatopa silvestrella
is similar to
H. biprojecta
in the female genitalia, but it can be separated by the elongate cylindrical antrum ( Fig. 18 ), which is funnel-shaped in
H. biprojecta
.

Distribution . China ( Gansu , Hebei , Heilongjiang , Henan , Jilin , Liaoning , Ningxia , Qinghai , Shanxi , Tianjin , Zhejiang ), Japan , Korea , Russian Far East (Primorskiy and Khabarovskiy territories).
